metadata.title: CVE-2017-18594 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
nse_libssh2.cc in Nmap 7.70 is subject to a denial of service condition dueto a double free when an SSH connection fails, as demonstrated by a leading\n character to ssh-brute.nse or ssh-auth-methods.nse.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ncat - 7.80+dfsg1-1
ndiff - 7.80+dfsg1-1
nmap - 7.80+dfsg1-1
nmap-common - 7.80+dfsg1-1
zenmap - 7.80+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nmap package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.80+dfsg1-1').
